newsitem.title: UK: British Gas "disappointed" by Falklands oil awards.
newsitem.headline: British Gas "disappointed" by Falklands oil awards.

text.p: British Gas Plc said on Monday it was disappointed by its failure to win a licence to explore for oil in waters north of the Falkland Islands but that it would study future opportunities in the region.
"We are naturally disappointed that we weren't selected but we will continue to watch developments in the South Atlantic very closely," a British Gas spokesman told Reuters.
Last November, British Gas signed an agreement with Argentina's YPF SA to study jointly the potential for oil and gas exploration around the Falklands.
The Falkland Islands government on Monday awarded oil exploration licences to 13 companies. Seven tranches of sea to the north of the islands, covering about 12,800 square km, were licensed.
